website_summaries.verdict: An ultra-popular cooling fan praised for its compact, slim, and portable construction.
pros: Extremely durable and built to last
Quiet fans come with fan speed adjustability
Great for cooling a number of electronic devices
Built with two different height settings
cons: A few buyers had problems with the electrical wire coming loose

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these over the course of several years. They seem to last about two years before the fan starts giving out and making noise. But that's not bad considering how little you pay. When operational, they work decently. It's not a powerhouse or anything but it does a decent job of moving the air. I like them because they are not bulky, don't have a bunch of dumb lights, and it's slim enough that it doesn't message up the feng shui of my work space. I have bought three thus far... and I would imagine I'll buy another one in about two years.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly "silent"
customer_reviews.text: This is the only laptop cooling pad I could find that didn't have LED lights. I don't want lights on my cooling pad, what I wanted was a silent cooling pad to keep my laptop cool while it is connected to an external monitor while I use Zoom. As it turns out, this is not nearly quiet enough, and it certainly isn't silent. It's loud enough that I can't use it while I'm on Zoom, because everybody can hear it. At least it is metal and holds the laptop off the desk surface, so its getting a little cooling, but not what I need it to be getting.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Decent laptop cooling pad
customer_reviews.text: Having previous experience with Cooler Master products, I tend to trust them for things like this. It's a decent laptop cooling pad. Nothing special. Doesn't have fan controls and it only has 1 USB port which is the back end of the USB plug. Doesn't raise up very high either. Does it keep my HP Omen 17 (runs very hot) any cooler? Hard to say, but I think during gaming, it might help lower temps by a couple of degrees.
customer_reviews.author: ZapixTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cools the laptop, like it's meant too.
customer_reviews.text: So this is no jet engine in here. It's a quite 160mm fan that blows a light breeze. This breeze is enough to cool my laptop down about 10 degrees. Nothing really spectacular but it's quite. If I really wanted to cool my laptop down a bunch I would of put a strong fan under it. At least now I have the mount that I can modify later to add a more powerful fan too. For the moment its enough cooling for what I'm doing. Pros Quite Cheep USB power Cons Stupid legs in the back that collapse if you push the laptop back. Fan isn't really that strong. It's a little bit smaller than my laptop
customer_reviews.author: E. Lorenzi

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop cooler
customer_reviews.text: I just received the cooler master notepad x-slim and I am very impressed. But what I can tell after running Unigine Heaven Benchmark, it lowered my temps by 5-7 degrees Celsius at ultra settings. Cooler is nice and quiet, lightweight, and does the job well. The only thing I am taking a star off for is the pegs at the back that prop up the laptop. They do not lock in place. If you move your cooler master away from you the legs snap back into close position. When I did that I almost hit the back of my 3 day old new laptop up against the elevated platform I have for my monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Morales jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fine for cooling, but noisier than desired for business use
customer_reviews.text: The design of this is good. If you are looking to cool day a gaming laptop, I’d recommend this unit. I am trying to keep noise level down in a small home office. It was about as noisy as the internal laptop fan that I was trying to keep off, so it was a wash for sound level. If they had put in a speed control it probably would have been great. Returned it reluctantly
customer_reviews.author: Gr8dork

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but a little loud
customer_reviews.text: This cooling pad does exactly what it supposed to: keep my laptop cool while in use. My laptop tends to get overheated when I'm running a game, so the cooling pad in a necessity. My only real complaint is that it is a little on the loud side. It's not terribly noticeable when there is other noise in the room. But it's definitely noticeable in a quiet room. All in all, it works as I need it to and I make sure it's unplugged when I need it to be quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jen K

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these at Fry's Electronics about ten years ago and the thing survived being on 24/7/365 all of that time. It does its job well for my use case. My original finally died, so I found it here on Amazon and ordered a replacement. I've got to say the replacement is noisier than the original was. Kind of disappointing. I think they changed something about its architecture over the past ten years because the USB plug is different, so who knows what else they changed. It seems to do well cooling, like the old one -- It's just noisier. I can hear it from other rooms now.
customer_reviews.author: C. Yarnell

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cooling Router (Asus RT AC87U)
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to cool an Asus router that overheats at room temperature, especially in warmer months. The Cooler Master NotePal X-Slim is powered via USB, so I plugged it into an available USB outlet on a surge protector. The router is a good one... until it overheats at random times. More often during warmer months. I have the laptop fan blowing directly at the top of the router and that does the trick to lower the CPU and radio temperatures about four degrees C. It does the trick to keeping the router stable. This was the easiest way to solve my router's overheating problem without having a workshop project and potentially ruin the router.
customer_reviews.author: C. Juniper

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and effective
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement for my last. Shuts down when system goes into hibernation. Fits my 15" laptop well. Very quiet. I actually picked up my laptop several times to check until I gained trust in it. Provides a good steady base for the computer. Pass through for the usb port is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm69

customer_reviews.title: It works  :)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my old laptop, which has an aging battery. The battery is constantly trying to charge, and therefore the laptop runs hot. I got this fan specifically for the larger size fan and so far it works well. Laptop stays cool. The larger fan is a little (tiny!) bit loud, but I think that's probably to be expected for the size of the fan. The sound is not bothersome. Overall, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Did it's job briefly
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, but if you are using on anything but a completely flat surface (and sometimes on flat surfaces) the fan seems to hit things and make a loud noise This broke within a few weeks but was still usable if I had the USB halfway stuck in the computer, now the entire thing fell apart. Really disappointing. The USB has pulled out of the casing entirely and is no longer even a little usable
customer_reviews.author: Megan W

customer_reviews.title: "Fan"tastic.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several coolers and this is the best one. Because when you use it on your lap you want your cooler having a big central fan to draw air from between your legs. If your fans are on the left and right (as most are) they'll be blocked by your legs. This one even has side vents. And a pass through for the USB so you won't lose a port. Fit's my 2015 14" Razor Blade perfectly. May be a bit small for a big 17" lap. My only complaint is if you pick it up with one hand in the center, the frame isn't strong enough and the plastic will start to catch the fan.
customer_reviews.author: damianicus

customer_reviews.title: Broke already
customer_reviews.text: I'v had this less than a year or MAYBE a year and its already falling apart. I will list issues below. 1. Top right fan light is already out. 2. Makes loud whining noise for 30 minutes before going quite. 3. Pegs at the bottom meant to stop laptop from sliding off are super weak, both broke off and have been superglued back on TWICE at this point. Only thing to say for this product is the fans keep spinning. Thats IT. I get that stuff is made to break but not even 1 year?!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2014 and this is still going strong! Despite it being banged here and there, this fan never gives up. It's the best product, great quality, and does the job. 100% recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R

customer_reviews.title: I like these so much I've bought 3 of them...
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, but I've bought 3 of these because I like the design. Large top grill, lots of air movement, air intake vents on the sides and bottom allow for it to be partially obstructed and still allow air to be drawn in. Could be lower profile or all aluminium, but for what it is and how it is designed and works, I've been pleased. The only cooler ive bought in the last 5 years and I've bought 3. 1 got dropped and tweaked, the other two were for two new laptops in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for MacBook Pro 18
customer_reviews.text: I do video edits in FL which make my poor little MacBook run really high and get freaking hot hot hot. This fan is very quiet and doesn't give off any vibrations. Super lightweight so I can throw it in my bag and not know its there. Wish it had usb-c to usb-c instead of to usb, but at least it has that!
customer_reviews.author: K. Doane

customer_reviews.title: Fan too loud for quiet room
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered I missed the specs in the Amazon listing stating it’s 16 to 20 dB. For a quiet office this is way too loud. Luckily I ordered two different styles and the other one is very quiet it has 5 fans. I’ll put this one in my server closet to produce airflow around other components.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my massive gaming computer cool
customer_reviews.text: My laptop is for gaming (ASUS ROG G74) and can get really hot. Especially since the battery is dead so it has to stay plugged in. I got this to keep it off my desk and am impressed. Before, where my desk would be hot enough to burn a child's finger, now when I lift the laptop/cooler it's actually cold under. I did not expect any results like this. Maybe just having it elevated for airflow has helped a ton. Either way, I'm no longer worried about a potential fire from my laptop getting too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have an old laptop I use for video streaming to a TV. It overheats all the time and shuts down. So instead of taking it apart or finding a newer option, I bought one of these. I haven't had an overheat since. Noise level is probably a little loud if you are right on top of it, but I don't notice it while in use. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Primevil60

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is out 3rd cooler (first I got fo my laptop then my husband took it for his, so I ordered 2nd one...my daughter took it, so now I ordered 3rd finally for me to keep lol). It really helps when u sit with laptop for prolonged time. My MacBook can get super warm so this pad is a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka Koszowska

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and no lights!
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and no lights! Helps keep my streaming devices air cooled. Not a tremendous amount of air moved by this fan, but it serves my purposes. I especially was looking for one without distracting lights.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Did not really work well for my laptops ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an alternative to the Havit cooler because more people reviewed this than the other laptop cooler. First, given the way I usually put the things at the center of these pads, the SINGLE central fan gets blocked and the side vents aren't really adequate to keep my laptops (15" MacBookPro and 11" Acer) cool. Even when not generating a video file from iMovie, the MBP was always very warm underneath - something that didn't happen with the 3-fan Havit solution. Second, the surface was really slippery and none of the notebooks stayed in place, so it's unusable as a tilted laptop stand. So I'm returning this thing and look at other multi-fan alternatives!
customer_reviews.author: KuzuMel

customer_reviews.title: The large fan moves a good amount of air
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough for it's design. It's a little under sized for my 17" HP, the rubber feet barely fit on the mesh surface of the pad. If they are the slightest bit off, the laptop will slide if it's not sitting level. The large fan moves a good amount of air. My mistake was that the laptop's cooling fan is in the upper left corner of my laptop, so it doesn't get direct air flow and maximum cooling. It still comes in handy when I want to sit my laptop on the couch or on the bed, to keep the vents from getting blocked.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Loud fan, slim profile
customer_reviews.text: This cooling pad is thin and very portable. However, the fan is very loud. The sound is more like a desktop fan and not what I would consider quiet. The Kootek Laptop Cooling Pad (with 5 fans) and the TopMate C302 10-15.6 Laptop Cooler Cooling Pad are both much quieter options. While functional, this cooling pad would not be useful in any public setting as you will likely attract the attention of everyone wondering where that fan noise is coming from.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: After ordering a different brand (which I returned) I bought this cooler master Note pal. It's great! While I'm not convinced any practical amount of fan air is really going to cool my computer down, it works fantastically to keep the airvents clear and off the sheets while I'm working in bed, and off my legs when working on the sofa. I use it everyday. Would be 5 stars but the metal of the grate was scratching the back of my laptop so I just put some of those rubber furniture bumpers on each corner. Works wonderfully as a fix but should really have been considered in the product design.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my set up.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my old Dell Inspiron 1564 (15.6 screen). This laptop get super hot, but not anymore. This cooling pad works well and the fan is about as loud as the fan on the laptop. I bought a right angle USB adapter (available here on Amazon) and thanks to the cable management I have a nice clean set up. NOTE: Mine must be a newer version because the USB connector on mine don't have that metal part at the end.
customer_reviews.author: K.hang

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for a 15.6" Dell 7559, but not much cooling going on :(
customer_reviews.text: Main use was to help keep an Inspiron 7559 cool during gaming. However, using HWMonitor I could not tell any difference between the laptop being on a flat even surface (desk) and on the cooling pad. The average package temp remained at 53-57C at >100% load (turbo at 3gHz). The fan is louder than the internal fan of the 7559. Given the 7559's design though (most cooling via rear-angled thermal vents) it's probably not a laptop that would benefit from a cooling pad anyway. I will try it with a more traditional laptop (an E6220) and update this review if the results are better.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Tom

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 45 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on 9/21/2014. It broke 10 minutes ago, on 11/09/2014. It isn't eligible for a return now. It was nice for that month, but would often click and make loud noises when sitting on a flat surface. Edit: After going to their website to see if the warranty covers it, I discovered the serial number on my fan has been removed. Except I never removed it, so now I can't register it for repair. I also discovered the problem, I am missing two (yes two) blades from the fan. I ended up removing them myself, and it came back on. Now it vibrates because the spinning fan is missing two of the cheap plastic blades.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Logan

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as advertised! AND size matters!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically chose this laptop cooler for a 17 in laptop. Wanted an oversized base. The dimensions in the product description state 18 inches. It is only 15 inches. It is only 15 by 10.5. The BOX it shipped in may be the the advertised dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and effective cooler pad.
customer_reviews.text: Works great.Comes in an affordable price range.My CoreTemp readings for the laptop stand between 40-50 degrees.This is when the laptop is running a minimal to moderate load.I must add though that while playing core games, the cooler pad loses some of its effectiveness and the laptop does become hot.This naturally creates a problem and hampers my gameplay experience.Fortunately this happened only once.Wait and watch. Word of advice--don't move the pad around when it's on.The fans make a nasty sound as they hit nearby components.I assume that the fans will get damaged if this happens again and again. Edit: Been using this thing for a year now. Still seems to be working great!
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Not just for laptops!!!
customer_reviews.text: This reliable and affordable piece of technology served me in two areas. Living in AZ, the extreme heat of the summers cause a dramatic increase in my electric bill. It becomes a loosing battle running my Air Conditioning while my home network simultaneously heats the enclosed space. Thankfully, this cooling pad reduced the ambient temperature in my office by three degrees, and another three degrees in my living room by placing a second cooling pad under my router. I highly recommend purchasing this item for either, especially if you have open USB ports and your equipment runs continuously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece to use with the laptop that I gave her so that she can do homeschooling. Since it's a bigger laptop, I knew that it would get warm if she used it all day. I always purchase laptop coolers for any of the laptops that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna S

customer_reviews.title: Does not actually cool your laptop or blow much air.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother wasting your time ordering this if you need it to actually cool your laptop. The cooler arrived super quickly, packaged well, and was of reasonably decent build quality. Plastic housing with a metal grille over the fan. It plugs in and spins up just fine, fairly quiet. However IT DOES NOT BLOW MUCH AIR, OR DECREASE YOUR TEMPS. You can barely feel it blowing on your hand, and after running stress tests and games, it did not lower my CPU or GPU temperature AT ALL. Not even 1 degree. Yes, my air intake is on the bottom of my Lenovo Y50 laptop. This cooler is not useful as a cooler. Not recommended at all
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Slim, sleek, effective, quiet, cool-looking, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: If you're finding that your computer is getting inordinately hot, even crashing in the heat, you'll not be disappointed by this fan. Its metal frame is study, not some cheap plastic, so you get strong cooling power from this guy. It's as quiet as the internal fan, so you'd probably not notice any increase in sound. My computer is coming up on 10 years old, so I get the feeling that I'm extending the life of my device by employing this fan.
customer_reviews.author: New Ideas

customer_reviews.title: The size is good, the fan is not.
customer_reviews.text: It's thin, light, and comfortably fits my 14" laptop with a little extra room to spare. It works well on both desks and laps, providing some extra room to let the laptop breathe (or just not roast your legs as much) even without the fan. Unfortunately the fan part of this unit is why I'm deducting stars here, because it's really not that good. Yes, it'll push air around just fine, but calling it "silent" is a gross overstatement and the USB plug feels flimsy. It sounds like a small box fan and is noisier than my laptop (albeit with a lower frequency sound). Some manner of variable speed control would have really helped here IMO.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dvorak

customer_reviews.title: Light and works.
customer_reviews.text: This decice lasted 2.5 years of daily use for 2-6 hours each day. It’s quiet and light. For the price I think I got my money’s worth. It just stopped working one day and couldn’t figure out what happened. If I took it apart to try and fix it I would not have been able to reassemble it. For the price this was a good product. Just bought a replacement. We shall see if it last as long
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: laptop users - you need a laptop pad to prevent overheating, this one is a good option
customer_reviews.text: Was searching for a laptop cooling pad for a new laptop, the old one I has was made for a 13" laptop and needed one to fit a 15.4". This product was right on the money - inexpensive, sturdy, and light. While it's not exactly really slim as you may think given the description, it worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Flaw in design
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes use my laptop in bed . When it’s on the sheets the fan doesn’t cool off properly. So I bought this item. Problem! This has a fan that ventilated through the mesh at the bottom , therefore it runs into the same problem as the laptop. So right now I’m using it as a laptop pad :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mehdi Horri

customer_reviews.title: Way too loud, about 30 dB
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes but I might have got a defective piece because it was SO loud. I put my Macbook Pro 15 inch on t and it got even louder. Will be trying a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Louis

customer_reviews.title: It... Works.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Cheap. Thats why I picked it. Sadly. - It works. Drops temps on my Macbook Pro 5-10c. Cons: - Feels flimsy. Eh, it was cheap, right? - Pass-Through USB is bulky. Seems like its always in the way, either too long, or the cord from the side is causing problems. - The cord sometimes pushes back into the unit, smacking into the fan. A zip tie fixed this. (Come on, 1 zip tie? how hard was that.) - You squeeze too hard, it smacks the fans. Annoying. I'd love to give this one more star, since it DID work as a laptop cooler, but there are too many downfalls to have earned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: ZERO cooling 'Cooler Master'
customer_reviews.text: I have never been more surprised and disappointed in a purchase over laptop cooling equipment in my LIFE. To be brief, this will NOT EVEN put out or flicker a flame directly from a hand held lighter. I'm not kidding. The 'high performance fan' is an unfortunately gimmick. The mesh over screen is what I think the main culprit is. When I mean ZERO airflow, you can lay a piece of paper ON TOP of it and it won't move it off.. Is that enough proof??! POS.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Returning as defective.  Incredibly LOUD noise coming from the fan.
customer_reviews.text: Something is wrong with this product. It makes a VERY LOUD SOUND when turned on. I thought maybe it was a fluke, but every time I turned it on, it was insanely loud, like a jet engine taking off. I'm very disappointed in the poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Renifer

customer_reviews.title: Highly, highly recommend this laptop cooling pad!
customer_reviews.text: My old laptop heats up more quickly these days than it used to so I really needed an external fan to help keep it cool. I've never used a laptop cooling pad before - but purchased this one because of the positive reviews - and I am so glad I did! It works wonderfully! It's a little difficult to keep my laptop from floating around on top of the unit - but totally worth it because my laptop stays cool - even in this summer heat! I purchased it for $14.99 - can't beat that price! I highly, highly, recommend this laptop cooling fan! I think it will extend the life of this old laptop of mine. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Lodena A. Benak

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat $14.98 and it does its job too
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price and does the job. I got this for my 13" MacBook Pro. At $14.98 and eligible for Prime, this was the least expensive option that I saw with the exception of one product which had zero reviews. So I went for it, and so far so good. The cooling pad comfortably seats my laptop, with about a an inch to half inch of the pad showing at the corners which doesn't bother me at all. Since the pad is made of mesh, it helps air circulate beneath the laptop even without using the fan. Much better than having the laptop sit on a flat, non-mesh surface. And for less than $15? No brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Mothra

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my AC88U router
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and is fairly quiet. Got this to cool down my AC88U router, as out of the box it runs towards the warmer side. I just set this under the router and plugged it in to the USB port on the back (It uses a USB pass through design) and set the router on top of it. In the summer months it dropped CPU and Wireless temps by approx 25+ degrees C. It is a large cooler. My router has about an inch plus to spare around all sides. I've been running this 24/7 for about 8 months now and it is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: This thing isn't even close to silent. It's cooling a router in a coat closet and I can hear the hum through the wall in the bedroom on the other side. It's loud enough that I find it difficult to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty loud
customer_reviews.text: Because this pad has a single large fan, I expected it to turn at a low RPM and be quiet. Actually it moves a lot of air and is pretty loud. I've ordered a variable resistor I can put inline with the USB power line to try to get it under control, but if that doesn't work I'm likely to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Catlin

customer_reviews.title: saved me from ditching my laptop
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is just what I needed. My laptop's fan failed and consequently the laptop overheated at the drop of a hat and shut off without any warning. I could not use my laptop to stream a movie or watch any video over about 10 minutes long. I had to be very careful about not putting the laptop on any soft, cushioned surface. Now, with this cooler, I can use my laptop continuously for hours, stream movies, etc with no problem what so ever. It makes a soft whirring noise which I don't mind at all. This is an economical solution to my problem. I really thought that I would have to replace my laptop, but this did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop cooler!
customer_reviews.text: My laptop (LG "Thin") stays in one place always, I do not move it. I don't play games with it, it's for banking and finances only. My PC is for everything else. I can't really comment as to the "gaming" or "ergonomics". It is very quiet, with a light breeze. I am happy and satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kenn L

customer_reviews.title: Good Laptop Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Good Laptop Cooler I bought this laptop cooler for my 17" laptop, 'cause I was having issues with the internal fan on the laptop, and the thing was getting really hot, in a short amount of time. The cooler really works. It doesn't make too much noise when is on. It takes air from the outside and pushes it into the base of the laptop, which at the same time pushes away the hot air on the inside of the laptop. All of this helps to keep the laptop at a considerable (and I could say... safe) temperature. Recommended!!! 5 out of 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: WWEBuster18

customer_reviews.title: A little thick and a bit oddly shaped, but works.
customer_reviews.text: Used for my gaming laptop, helped prevent heat-induced slowdowns, but overall didn't make a HUGE difference but I would never expect a miracle from a pad like this. Definitely helpful for prolonging the health of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant but not for my Mac
customer_reviews.text: What impressed me about the thought put into this cooler was the USB connector. It tucks in neatly underneath --- but has enclosures for both left and right sides, so you don't need to think about which USB ports to use. I also like the single fan, open air design. I've used Cooler Master products forever and would like to use this one. Unfortunately, it just doesn't cool my Mac, partially because of its solid aluminum undercarriage. There's just not enough airflow. I can imagine it working on my ThinkPad, which has a traditional accessible bay doors. Also, if your laptop doesn't have rubber bumpers on its base, it's easy for the computer to slip off the cooling pad.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: Item is relatively slim, with legs for additional height/angling ...
customer_reviews.text: Item is relatively slim, with legs for additional height/angling if desired. Usb acts as power source and is double sided so it does not actually eliminate a port. Has a very well ventilated surface and draws in plenty of air with a perfectly sized fan. Non slip on surface and bottom. Circulates well on some soft surfaces. Fan shuts off when laptop is on sleep, off, etc. Fan is very quiet, not absolutely silent but it's barely audible. I have noticed a positive difference in laptop speed related to coolness using this product.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Very good design
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job of cooling your hot pc very well. I run programs such as multisim and matlab, and when it is plugged in, it keeps my pc from overheating. It has a nice design to it, and even makes the plug a usb connection so you don't lose one of your usb ports, however, the usb port extension is a bit hard to get a usb into, maybe cause its new, but it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Not that quiet
customer_reviews.text: I returned this cooler because it has no means to adjust fan speed, no additional USB ports and was a bit louder than I expected. It worked and it's very slim, but the noise was a bit bothersome for me.
customer_reviews.author: W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fans a little lower than my laptop sometimes but it's still amazing
customer_reviews.text: The best stand I've found so far. It's very easy to disassemble if you want to take it apart and mod it but if you want to add more fans make sure they're thin enough.(had to return some because they were too thick) But I recommend clearing the plastic part where the fan sites and invert the fan because blowing air into the computer probably isn't that efficient but honestly I didn't see if it had any difference on the computer
customer_reviews.author: Ethan s Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to provide air space between my laptop and whichever surface I place it on. I don't use the fan, don't need it, the pad weighs almost nothing and is just a centimeter over the width and depth of my laptop. It's perfect for what I need. I did not give 5 stars since I don't know how useful the fan would be -
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value!
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to expectations. Very slim, light weight and unobtrusive. The pass-through USB connector is welcome, since the unit doesn't monopolize a USB port. Our HP laptop (17.5") has a smooth bottom, so a set of Velcro sticky-dots solved any potential slipping issues. Now it's like the cooler and laptop are a single unit. Time will tell how well the motor holds up. Very quiet UPDATE: 11/28/15 After 6 months of causal use, never being moved around, dropped or otherwise mistreated, it was turned on one morning and one of the fan blades simply snapped off! Unit became unusable due to broken vane rattling around in case. Buyer be aware....
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 17 inches HP G60-235 laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I am shock how well this plastic fan works. My past fan was an aluminum Aeolous Enemax which lasted me 10 years. This mimics my late expensive one pretty well. It blows very strong yet quiet air up the bottom of my HP G60-235DK (almost 17 inches). My laptop sits perfectly on top without moving. It's actually very sturdy. I can't even push it with one female hand. So far I've had no problems and it's been a month in use now. For the price, its pretty good. I don't expect a long life but as long as it last 6 months or a year, its worth the price below $20. No funny noise, plastic smell or other issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gaia

customer_reviews.title: Anti- DV Disease?
customer_reviews.text: Purchase two of these for my husband and I who have both HP laptops. As of late, HP has some problems with laptops not cooling properly that overtime would loose video due to overheating issues also known as the "DV Disease". We both this as a precaution, my husband's laptop stays on a desk and mine on my laptop when in use. It keeps it cool at all times, fits are laptop which are both 17inch. My only complaint since I do set this on my laptop, the usb extender end scratches my leg up (my usb ports are on the sides). Other than that, appears to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good thing I can turn off my hearing aids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the old cooling pad I had was beginning to make noise. This one started out quiet enough but, over the last 5-6 months it has gradually gotten noisier and noisier. Not "the fan bearings are shot" noisy like the old cooling pad but just more noticeable. I am sometimes fooled into thinking it's the furnace blower but it's just this pad. I'm long past the 30-day window to return it to Amazon and it is physically more comfortable in my lap than the old pad was so I'm just putting up with the fan noise for now. Maybe I'll get myself an early Christmas present.....
customer_reviews.author: R. HurleyTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: although it did a better job when the fan worked
customer_reviews.text: Its not very durable, my USB cable stopped working after 2 to 3 months, but on the upside I found out it provided just enough cooling for my Macbook pro mid 2010 13" without the fan, although it did a better job when the fan worked. Its not even all the durable all around, its now got a crack in it that is spilling down the middle. I admit that back packing with it might be hard on it, but I'm ultra sensitive to that fact and have babied it as best I can (and its been rather babied I might add).
customer_reviews.author: khronosschoty

customer_reviews.title: As a matter of fact I think in general the laptop is performing better now. I have had the cooling fan for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a really old laptop. It runs really hot. It is so beat up. The whole screen cover is cracked and broken. I can't even close it. It does the job though. Still working even on it's last legs. I was about to give it up because it was shutting down due to heating up so much. This Cooler Master did the trick. Have had no problems with shut downs. As a matter of fact I think in general the laptop is performing better now. I have had the cooling fan for about a month. The pass thru USB is great. Just hope it lasts as long as my laptop has.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to shutoff the CPU fan noise, but this fan is even noiser
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. The fan is noisy. And if you don't place a notebook ontop and push it back past the logo you will get grating noises. Pros ***** Price Fan Cons ***** Noisy Makes a grating noise when placing a notebook closer to the product logo No on/off switch Doesn't resolve the CPU fan coming on, so notebook is still getting hot
customer_reviews.author: LinkedInSecrets - Author of 4 LinkedIn Books

customer_reviews.title: a useful and reasonably priced fan
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a useful and reasonably priced fan. Pros: surprisingly lightweight, but still fairly sturdy Easy to use No louder than a normal laptop fan by itself Neutral: Many laptops have side fans, so this isn't as effective as it could be, since all of the airflow is directed towards the bottom center of the laptop. Cons: The bottom plastic is a little thin, so if you move it while it's on, you're likely to have the fan scrape against the bottom grate. Neither really detract enough from the product to warrant removing any stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Nice Design, Not Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Unit is nicely constructed and feels pretty solid. The USB cable manager (hooks under the unit) keep things neat. The feet do an adequate job of raising the unit -- and your laptop -- to supposedly increase airflow. Cons: The biggest con is that the airflow doesn't seem very adequate at all -- I could hardly feel any air circulating. As a result, my laptop didn't feel any cooler. If anything, and I don't think this was my imagination, but my laptop actually felt warmer when this fan was using the USB connection and running. Finally, the unit was louder than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Temperature goes up - but with good reason
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15” MacBook Pro to help reduce the heat during heavy use - at first I was disappointed to see the temperature difference was minimal if not worse than without using the cooling pad. On closer inspection from using iStat reports the notebook fan was running on average 1000 rpm lower during high loads, with the cooling fan in use. So in short, it does work to lower temperatures but if you have your own heat management on your laptop, it may seem to work against the intention of having a cooling fan. I’m overall very pleased with the purchase given the price and the large fan also is quiet to use in an office environment
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this when I first bought it. Slim, study, did the job without breaking the bank. I've now had this for about a year, and it doesn't work very well anymore. Normally when plugging this into your computers USB port, it turns on. Mine has stopped doing this until I push it forward or backward while it's plugged in, and then it MAY work. So at this point I'd need to rebuy it. So don't expect this to last longer than a year. I will buy something higher quality next time, since I definitely use this for my MacBook Pro all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: NO real issues - it works!
customer_reviews.text: It's a little thick for actual laptop use, but it has a fan and needs room to move the air. So I guess it has to take up a little room. I don't really have anything negative about it. If your laptop creates too much heat, this is a sure cure. It plugs into a usb port, so there's nothing extra to deal with, and it definitely moves the air. It will keep both your laptops plenty cool. The noise level is less annoying than I would have expected, although it does exist. That's another "have-to" if you want the air moved, right? I used this with my old laptop and I didn't have any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: wallywetlake

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop cooler is good, it help cool down my laptop easily when my laptop is overheating. It fit well with my big Toshiba laptop, I was surprised! This is definitely a good use for gaming and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trang Le

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, smooth, and comfortable~!
customer_reviews.text: Besides being a great looking item with great features...like the 'hide-away' cable that goes to EITHER side, AND the port duplicator (so you don't 'lose' that USB connection) ....it works great! The darn thing is printed in about 25 languages so I imagine it's been well-researched and tested. Good rubber feet, not the kind that rub or pop off. Drop-down rear feet...also with great rubber. Just a great piece for a great price. I bought two....one for gift.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crow

customer_reviews.title: and this does just fine as a basic unit with no bright lights or ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked through different brands, and this does just fine as a basic unit with no bright lights or other things. It's not very loud and the power cable is integrated, so you won't damage the cable or the socket. There is also a space around the feet/fan housing to wrap the cable so you can take this pad with out and not worry about damaging the power cable. USB pass-thru isn't a major concern, but it works without blocking other ports. Great value for a sub $20 product.
customer_reviews.author: XCD83784

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Built/Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is very cheaply built. The unit I received made a ticking noise. It was obvious the fan blade(s) were hitting somewhere. Unfortunately you can't take the cooler apart. Might have been an easy fix. I returned the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best laptop cooling pad that I have owned (and I ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best laptop cooling pad that I have owned (and I have owned quite a few!). The larger diameter fan is quiet though not silent. It moves enough air to make a difference. With the laptop cooler, my laptop internal fan still runs, but at a much reduced speed. It is easier to replace an external laptop cooling pad than the internal fan of a computer. Note that most laptops will power up the USB ports when it is sleeping, which keeps this laptop cooler running when it does not need to. So far, I have no complaints whatsoever because even with the excessive running of the laptop cooler, it is still working reliably and quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Tak Auyeung

customer_reviews.title: Useful but you dont really need it
customer_reviews.text: Won't cool down your system but will blow some nice air at you. This is just great to have to put under your laptop if you put it on a table. Dont use this on a pillow or your bed as it will bend and the plastic will hit the fan
customer_reviews.author: F. Tech

customer_reviews.title: would reccommend.
customer_reviews.text: I only use this for work, but i love it. Added points for not having forced lighting to go along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Benito Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Flawless and very well built
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 17” R4 Alienware. R4 is HUGE and weighs 10lbs so this can handle ANYONE’S laptop. I‘ve also often ran it consecutive months with no break 24/7. Flawless
customer_reviews.author: Stunado

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the office to keep my notebook cool. My notebook sits on it well. The air flows into the bottom vents on the notebook. I can barely hear the fan when the notebook in on top of it. I can hear the fan without the notebook which is good since it reminds me to unplug it since I use a powered hub to run the fan. Seems pretty sturdy. The only con I have is that it needs to sit on a fairly flat surface. At home I have it sitting on a cushion and this sometimes hits the fan blades. I guess that's how they keep it thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: awesome and doesn't cost a freakin` fortune
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one and then purchased another for my niece and I just bought a third one for back up , just in case. I absolutely love them. Quiet, slim, no problems at all. First one purchased in March 2014, next one in Nov 2014, the third one just today. I go through keyboards faster than fans. Maybe Cool Master needs to design keyboards...LOL Update 3/4/2017 Not sure about Nieces cooler, but my two are still working. One is just now starting to get a little noisy so am purchasing another. These have really been worth what little money I've paid, and now they've even dropped in price.
customer_reviews.author: CC Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooling power while also very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many different cooling pads since I currently use an old HP G6 laptop that runs quite hot. This is by far the best one I've purchased, it provides an amazing amount of cooling power for how slim it is. It is also very quiet, I have no problem studying or doing homework while the fan is running under my laptop. It is also ideal for gaming on a laptop, even after hours of use my laptop still retails a very mild temperature. Lastly for this low of price I don't believe you will find a better product around as I have myself tried many of them within this price point and none compare.
customer_reviews.author: thamadmatt

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing! I have bought many other laptop fans but ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I have bought many other laptop fans but none even come close to this one. The Cooler Master NotePal X-Slim Ultra-Slim Laptop Fan is one of the thinnest and quietest laptop coolers that I have used. The fan is powered through USB and there is a USB pass-through for the USB plug that it uses to get power. The fan is not as thin as my laptop so I can't stuff it inside my laptop bag to carry around. However, this thing does the job when I want to game on my laptop without overheating! Overall, I would recommend getting this laptop fan!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L.

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, sleek, and not easily damaged, this cooler is perfect for my laptop while I'm gaming and doubles as a comfy platform while I'm sitting in bed with my laptop on my legs. I've had it for months and there are no nicks, dings, or scratches, nothing is peeling off, and it just looks brand new overall. I would recommend it to anyone - I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Made a big difference in my new Dell Laptop operating temps.
customer_reviews.text: Temperature drop was noticeable, and immediate. Small price to pay for something that will extend the life of your laptop, and keep your legs cool at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: PuterGeek2

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, quiet, and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the "X-Slim / Ultra-Slim" description (it's about 1 1/8" thick), so there are slimmer ones out there. Purchased this to use with a 15" Lenovo Y-700. When used for surfing, or apps not requiring much horse power, the laptop's fans rarely kick-in, but when using-it for gaming, the base used to get pretty hot. This cooler seems to keep things under control, and really like the fact that there's no lights on this unit - yea, they look neat, but I don't need to have lights I can't really see.
customer_reviews.author: gewf631

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This cooling fan works great, at first. Unfortunately, after about 4 months of normal use, the cord became detached inside, causing it to get hit by the fan blades. Then, all of the cord that is supposed to stay inside the casing fell out, leaving a critical connection exposed. After that was patched back up, the fan blades got caught on something inside, and one of them snapped off. It's now useless unless I can get the casing open to remove the broken fan blade. Bottom line, this would be a great product, if it were put together in a way that would allow it to last more than 6 months. As it is, don't waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason and Heather

customer_reviews.title: to my delight, it didn't make a sound
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was very exited about this product. When I first put in on, to my delight, it didn't make a sound! I even checked to make sure that the fan was working, it being so quite. I've been barely using it only a few hours every day, since mid March. After less than 2.5 months of use it's no longer working. Came onto Amazon to see if I could exchange it....it's apparently beyond the time. In my opinion, don't waste your money, use the money towards a more reliable product the will last more than a few months!
customer_reviews.author: Ilene A. Rosales

customer_reviews.title: It works damn well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dell xps 9360. It's a bit big for it... but man. It works. When I start hearing the fans spinning high, I put it on the cooling pad and a few minutes later the fan speed drops. Not bad at all. My only gripe (nitpick really) is that the cooler master sticker came undone from its indented location. But who cares. It works.
customer_reviews.author: KindredGhost

customer_reviews.title: the laptop cools better when it's elevated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop fan last summer, and overall, it's okay. Lately, there were quite a few times where my computer shut down due to overheating, even with the fan plugged in. It becomes very frustrating when you're writing grad papers! I realized I need to unplug the laptop adapter AS SOON AS it's fully charged, the laptop cools better when it's elevated, and I cannot play music on my computer as the battery is recharging. As I learn what works best, I'm getting better use out of the fan. I think I'll try the upgraded version, next time, but overall, this fan isn't bad.
customer_reviews.author: Aliyah

customer_reviews.title: but this or other laptop coolers seem to be unnecessary. The product is not silent
customer_reviews.text: It kind of does what it's intended to do, but this or other laptop coolers seem to be unnecessary. The product is not silent. you can hear the fan noise. What is more beneficial for the laptop is to elevate the back end by putting a small block or some cheap material to elevate the laptop. Another thing that seems to cool down the temperature of the computer is to download a program "speedfan" and control the laptop fan's speed. A port of usb can also be saved by not using this type of cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Work just fine.!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using the this cooling pad with my dell Inspiron 7373. Now, my laptop run at 3-5 degree C lower temperature with this pad. I am happy with it. However, I am having problem with height adjustment. The cooling pad does not stay put on rise. It fall down with very little push, even when you type on laptop keyboard. This thing is not important to me, so I am keeping it. I recommend this cooling pad for casual laptop use. This is not for gaming.!!
customer_reviews.author: Anamika chauhan

customer_reviews.title: The Best Any Laptop Can Get!
customer_reviews.text: The Best Any Laptop Can Get! (Disclaimer; review is based upon personal experience only, I do not work, get paid, or sponsored by either Amazon or the manufacturer to review products! If Amazon or a manufacturer wants me to review their products, email me please!)
customer_reviews.author: critic

customer_reviews.title: Eh...It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: First thing I took it out of the box, I said to myself, "Wow, this thing is almost going to break." It just feels SO light but it's very high quality, I got it for $17 so I wasn't expecting top of the line quality and performance. Super light makes it easy to move around, my laptop starts to slide a little if I push it too hard but otherwise doesn't move. Cooling performance isn't that great, I'm paranoid about temps because of my gaming desktop which is why I got one. Fan noise is very quiet for me, my desktop sounds like a tornado at full speed and this sounds almost dead silent to me.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Noise/Vibration Issue
customer_reviews.text: I've been using one since March 2017. I carried it in my backpack everywhere and it held up well. I was happy enough with it to buy a second one in December 2017 as a backup. Last week I pulled the backup out of storage and found it had a strange secondary vibration and noise. So, I ordered another one from Amazon this weekend. Well, the new one has similar vibration and noise, just not as bad. I guess the engineers found a way to make these things cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: SUNG Y.

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two years back, and ever since, it's helped keep my laptop reasonably cool when playing games. They don't crash as much as they used to. It's pretty easy to clean when dust accumulates too-- just pull up the ten metal tabs under the rim to remove the metal mesh and wipe the inside. Be careful not to cut yourself on the sharp edge, though. Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Leggett

customer_reviews.title: Decent cooling fan.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent fan platform for a laptop that either over-heats or that has an external monitor and you keep the cover down. You must remember to periodically clean off the dust that builds up between the FAN and the VENTS on the bottom of the LAPTOP! I find that it helps to keep the space between the laptop screen and laptop keyboard open so that residual heat can escape. I need to use an external monitor because of a problem with the laptop itself, not worth fixing but laptop works fine, so I also use an external keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: MandBinc

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Quiet Fan
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cooler Master. I had the last one for over three years and it is still working, but was getting very noisy and the USB connection has become worn and does not stay firmly in the slot on my computer. The new model which is shown here is better than my old model as the 'pass-through' USB connector is now smooth and therefore does not catch on clothing. I really like the side, back and front vents. Works well for my computer and this new one is almost completely silent. Great value for a cooling fan for my 17" laptop.
customer_reviews.author: cj543oregon

customer_reviews.title: A decent smaller low profile cooler but don't expect to keep it for very long
customer_reviews.text: This one was just okay. It was very low profile but only lasted roughly half a year. It burned out at random but the difference between having it on and just using it to elevate a laptop was negligible. The fan doesn't spin very fast at all so I think for the money you can probably find much better. I purchased the X3 model from the same brand Cooler Master and the difference between this and that model is significant enough to warrant overlooking this one unless you are using a netbook or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: coolthings1991

customer_reviews.title: Tough adn Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and its tough. I am traveling so this and my gaming rig are in my backpack bicycling everyday, not to mention I have gotten mad at it after drinking to much and punched dents into it, (dont ask why)and its still going strong. THis is the second one of these I have purchased and when it dies, I will buy another one. Well worth it, and it keeps my notebook cool while gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Last one I bought lasted years/on my 2nd now
customer_reviews.text: Liked it so much I bought it again after the last one finally gave out! (Used it for school) It’s decently priced and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Susi B
